Description: Large pottery dish with ledge rim made of fine Nile silt fabric, coated with thick red slip. Interior is lightly and broadly combed and polished to produce a rippled effect. Rim top is also rippled. Exterior is mottled, with vague indication of rippling. Ancient repairs hole present drilled from the exterior
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (pl. xv.3F)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
